snippet: War-time suicide attempts are most common in newer enlisted soldiers who have not been deployed, according to a study billed as the most comprehensive analysis of a problem that has plagued the United States military in recent years.
abstract: Study in journal JAMA Psychiatry finds that wartime suicide attempts are most common among newly enlisted soldiers who are yet to be deployed.
lead_paragraph: War-time suicide attempts are most common in newer enlisted soldiers who have not been deployed, according to a study billed as the most comprehensive analysis of a problem that has plagued the United States military in recent years.

headline.main: Suicide Attempts Are Most Common in Newer Soldiers, a Study Says
headline.print_headline: Suicide Attempts Are Most Common in Newer Soldiers, a Study Says

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
